definition: to be jealous of (sb's achievements etc)/to be envious/envy
to be jealous of/fear/dread/scruple/to avoid or abstain from/to quit/to give up sth

sentences.english: I didn't know you were the jealous type.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道原來你是一個妒忌心重的人。

sentences.english: Bill grudged Dick his prize even though he had won a better prize himself.
sentences.chinese: 比爾妒忌迪克獲獎，儘管他自己獲得了更高的榮譽。

sentences.english: Envy shoots at others and wounds himself.
sentences.chinese: 妒忌心射向別人，受傷的卻是自己。

sentences.english: Jung know envy envy zhi jun, can only every comfort.
sentences.chinese: 日俊知道羨花妒忌芷君，只能百般安慰。

sentences.english: You will learn how to keep jealousy from coming between the two of you.
sentences.chinese: 你將學會如何在兩人今後的相處中遠離妒忌之心。

sentences.english: 20 love will make people very worried about, also can let a person envy hate.
sentences.chinese: 愛會讓人牽腸掛肚，也會讓人妒忌生恨。

sentences.english: If you are holding onto a grudge or bitterness, Satan will be able to push you around.
sentences.chinese: 如果你持有妒忌和怨恨，撒旦將不離你左右。

sentences.english: Her behaviour excited Kehr to jealousy.
sentences.chinese: 她的行爲引起了凱爾的妒忌。

sentences.english: He comports himself correctly in the world and does not envy anyone here.
sentences.chinese: 他在世上行爲正直，不妒忌任何人。

sentences.english: A gentleman will never hurt a woman under any circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 一個真正有教養的人是沒有妒忌猜疑或報復心的。

sentences.english: It was all for extortion, greed, advantages and jealousy.
sentences.chinese: 全都是基於勒索，貪婪，利益及妒忌心所致。
奧賽羅是位妒忌心很重的丈夫。

sentences.english: This means to say that he is remote from greed, jealousy, anger, and distorted views.
sentences.chinese: 這就是說他遠離貪婪，妒忌，憤怒，和邪見。

sentences.english: Jealousy is simply envy of other people’s success.
sentences.chinese: 嫉妒是對他人成功的簡單妒忌。

sentences.english: What instrument do violists envy most?
sentences.chinese: 什麼樂器是中提手最妒忌的？

definition: to be jealous of (sb's achievements etc)/to be envious/envy
to hate out of jealousy/to resent
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
to be suspicious and jealous of
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
